posts.title: My Garage
posts.description: Here I practiced Node, Express and EJS. A simple CRUD application for storing data about cars.

posts.title: JobsInFinlandClone
posts.description: This project was a excercise in cloning a UI with plain HTML, CSS, JS

posts.title: BandmateFinder
posts.description: A social media app created for musicians. Users can create profiles, and connect with other users by commenting on their profiles. The users address is geocoded on the backend when signing up based on city and postal code, and the coordinates are stored to MongoDB along with the other information. You can filter users on the map so only users playing a certain instrument are shown. Technologies: React, Node, Express, mongoDB, Here Maps, Bcrypt for salting and hashing passwords, Node geocoder.

posts.title: Mock Blog App
posts.description: Mock Blog application to practise simple routes, nested routes and conditional rendering in React.

posts.title: Todo App
posts.description: Simple Todo App built with React and redux.

posts.title: Group Project 2
posts.description: Built with React, Node. Second group project from BCH. It is a beginning of a social media app where the core idea is that logged in users can store posts containing addresses that will be rendered on a map. I worked with React components and implemented HERE maps.

posts.title: Speed Game
posts.description: Built with React. Game based on the classic reaction speed game.

posts.title: Interactive CV, Flappy Bird style
posts.description: HTML, CSS, Javascript. Here I practised object oriented programming. On desktop you can use space to jump and arrows to move sideways, on mobile you use the buttons on the screen.

posts.title: Typescript calculator
posts.description: Here I practised typescript and wrote the calculator logic in two different ways. The first version more hand crafted, the second one using eval().

posts.title: Group Project 1
posts.description: HTML, CSS, Javascript. Group project in Business College Helsinki with the working name 'Are you bored?'. It is an application that gives the user suggestions of books to read, music to listen to, news to read and movies to watch, depending on what genre or topic the user chooses. The application fetches data from four different APIs. I implemented the logic and UX/UI for the music and movie sections.

posts.title: Covid-19 Tracker
posts.description: A Covid-19 tracking application built with React. Using matching algorithm to give suggestions of countries as you type.
